delimitDateTime

public static List delimitDateTime(Date startDateTime,
                                   Date endDateTime,
                                   int delimitedSecond)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException
Delimits to the date time list by a startDateTime, endDateTime and delimitedSecond. For example : the startDateTime is "2010-01-01 00:00:00", the endDateTime is "2010-01-01 00:02:00", the delimitedSecond is 60, so the return list is [2010-01-01 00:00:00, 2010-01-01 00:01:00, 2010-01-01 00:02:00]; Another situation the startDateTime is "2010-01-01 00:00:00", the endDateTime is "2010-01-01 00:01:50", the delimitedSecond is 60, the return list is also [2010-01-01 00:00:00, 2010-01-01 00:01:00, 2010-01-01 00:02:00].

Parameters:
startDateTime - the start date time
endDateTime - the end date time
delimitedSecond - the delimited second
Returns:
the instance of List
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException

getRangeDateTimes

public static Date[] getRangeDateTimes(List dateTimes,
                                       Date dateTime,
                                       boolean millisecondIgnored)
Gets the rang date array.

Parameters:
dateTimes - the date time list
dateTime - the date time
millisecondIgnored - the boolean value whether millisecond is ignored or not
Returns:
the range date array.
